In Portugal, S. sisymbriifolium is not part of the native flora
29 , but other plants of the same genus, for instance S. linnaeanum Hepper & P.-M.L. Jaeger, which is similar to S. sisymbriifolium (Supplementary Fig. S1), are present in the South of Portugal
30, 31 . It is an invasive species of plant, spiny, with an extensive root system, and is probably native from Southern Africa although it is a common weed in North Africa and Southern Europe
30, 32 .
